meanings.definition: To steer a vehicle too much in a particular direction, causing loss of control.
meanings.sent1: The driver was oversteering around the corner, making the car swerve dangerously.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to oversteer when making sharp turns to avoid accidents.
meanings.sent3: The oversteering squirrel on the road made everyone laugh as it struggled to stay on course.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions oversteered her actions, leading to unexpected consequences.
meanings.sent5: Oversteering in icy conditions can result in a loss of traction and spinouts.

meanings.definition: The act of turning the steering wheel too far in one direction, leading to instability.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic explained that oversteering can cause the car to fishtail uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: Excessive oversteering can wear out the tires faster than normal steering.
meanings.sent3: The oversteering of the shopping cart in the store aisle almost crashed into a display.
meanings.sent4: The oversteering of the ship's wheel in the storm symbolized the captain's panic.
meanings.sent5: The oversteering of the bicycle made it wobble dangerously on the uneven road.

meanings.definition: The tendency of a vehicle to turn more sharply than intended due to excessive steering input.
meanings.sent1: The sports car's oversteering made it drift effortlessly around the track.
meanings.sent2: Drivers should be aware of the risks of oversteering on slippery roads.
meanings.sent3: The oversteering of the remote-controlled car amused the children as it spun in circles.
meanings.sent4: The oversteering of the conversation led to misunderstandings between the friends.
meanings.sent5: The oversteering of the lawnmower made it veer off course and into the flower bed.
